title: Font ID: 70s font ID please
content:
Hi there,  
Does anyone recognise this scrap of font?  
It’s from an old magazine cover. I’ve hunted around but haven’t found it. Perhaps one of you font gurus know? Would appreciate any assistance.

Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060525im_/http:/typophile.com/files/70s_mystery_font_3591.jpg)

 [‹ a?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060525/http:/typophile.com/node/45752 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font Help Please (from a newb) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060525/http:/typophile.com/node/45749 "Go to next forum topic")
author: nozomi

comments.content: Wow, that doesn’t look ’70s at all. Looks like something made this year by a hobbiest in Illustrator. The first thing that comes to mind (especially with that wacky ’T’) is [Pasadena](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060525/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/elsner_flake/pasadena_light/).
Hmmm. I’ll try to get some more info on the magazine from my client.

Solved! It’s Boulder. [http://www.dafont.com/boulder.font?text=ETSPLAYOVE](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060525/http:/www.dafont.com/boulder.font?text=ETSPLAYOVE "http://www.dafont.com/boulder.font?text=ETSPLAYOVE")

Many thanks to metro2005 on MyFonts WTF for that.
What do I win for at least saying what it is not?
